content:
• Friday, February 15, 2013

  • The week's ETF movers - Gainers: TAN +10.68%. KOL +2.78%. EWY +2.38%.  XHB +2.32%. AMJ...

    The week's ETF movers - Gainers: TAN +10.68%. KOL +2.78%. EWY +2.38%.  XHB +2.32%. AMJ +1.68%.
    ETF Losers: GAZ -9.58%. GDXJ -6.97%. PSLV -6.27%. GDX -5.74%. SIVR -5.33%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM
  • PSUN

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: PSUN +6%. NSM +5%. MGM +4%. NOG +4%. HK +4%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: PSUN +6%. NSM +5%. MGM +4%. NOG +4%. HK +4%.
    After-hours top losers: SKH -5%. EPB -5%. WOOF -4%. LCI -4%. PRSS -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:46 PM
  • QLIK

    Qlik (QLIK +17.9%) closed at levels last seen in May '12 thanks to its Q4 beat and strong 2013...

    Qlik (QLIK +17.9%) closed at levels last seen in May '12 thanks to its Q4 beat and strong 2013 guidance. RBC has upgraded shares to Buy, pleased with 25.5% Y/Y billings growth and a 1K Q/Q increase in total customers to over 27K. CEO Lars Bjork says the closing of several big healthcare deals lifted Q4 results, and that Q1 EPS will be light partly due to investments in the next-gen version of the company's flagship QlikView business intelligence software.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM
  • XOOM

    Xoom (NASDAQ:XOOM) IPO buyers can't complain about the company's first day of trading. Shares...

    Xoom (NASDAQ:XOOM) IPO buyers can't complain about the company's first day of trading. Shares continued to rally following a sizable pop at the open, and finished the day at $25.49, up 59.3%. Western Union (WU +1.8%) and MoneyGram (MGI +0.8%) may have received a slight boost from the offering. (previous: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • OWW

    Orbitz (NYSE:OWW) +1.5% AH after stating it's "exploring strategic alternatives" for its Away...

    Orbitz (NYSE:OWW) +1.5% AH after stating it's "exploring strategic alternatives" for its Away Network division, which includes Away.com, Trip.com, GORP.com, and AdventureFinder.com. The company adds a sale won't change its 2013 earnings outlook. Orbitz, whose shares have been depressed for some time as the company loses ground to bigger rivals Priceline and Expedia, is up 25% since it posted a Q4 revenue beat on Thursday morning.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • EHTH

    Online health insurance company eHealth (EHTH -22.4%) plunges late in the session after missing...

    Online health insurance company eHealth (EHTH -22.4%) plunges late in the session after missing Q4 estimates and posting lower than anticipated guidance for FY13. It nowe sees its EPS coming in around $0.61 to $0.71, lagging expectations for $0.76 per share. Revenue is projected in a range of $168M to $174M, straddling analyst views for $171.6M.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • TRW

    TRW Automotive (TRW +1.4%) trades up after its Q4 easily beat estimates earlier today. Net...

    TRW Automotive (TRW +1.4%) trades up after its Q4 easily beat estimates earlier today. Net earnings actually fell 1.4% Y/Y however, partly due to restructuring and other charges, though the auto-parts maker surprised with higher revenue. Gross margin shrank to 10.5% from 11.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • WPRT

    This morning's spike in shares of Westport Innovations (WPRT +7.6%) on takeover speculation...

    This morning's spike in shares of Westport Innovations (WPRT +7.6%) on takeover speculation gains momentum into the close. Chatter centers around potential interest from Cummins (CMI +0.3%), already involved in a JV that accounts for much of WPRT's medium-term profits.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 17 Comments
  • ALXN

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN -1.8%) slips after Stifel Nicolaus cuts its price target on the...

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN -1.8%) slips after Stifel Nicolaus cuts its price target on the shares from $125 to $118. The firm says that despite posting solid top and bottom line growth last year, the timing of European aHUS reimbursements and incremental data/news flow is mostly back-weighted to the second half.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • GFI

    It's rough sledding today for gold miners (GDX -3.4%), and especially so for Gold Fields (GFI...

    It's rough sledding today for gold miners (GDX -3.4%), and especially so for Gold Fields (GFI -7.4%), which suffered a BofA downgrade to Neutral from Buy. Discontinued KDC and Beatrix operations were making material contributions to both earnings and cash flow, the firm says; their exclusion lowers GFI's valuation to the lower end of global peers.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • OCSL

    Fifth Street Finance (FSC -2.3%) takes a late-day tumble after being downgraded to Sell at...

    Fifth Street Finance (FSC -2.3%) takes a late-day tumble after being downgraded to Sell at Gilford Securities. 
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • FDO

    Discounters are falling harder than other retail stocks after Wal-Mart's leaked internal warning...

    Discounters are falling harder than other retail stocks after Wal-Mart's leaked internal warning on February sales creates a large ripple effect. The verdict was out on how hard higher payroll taxes would hit the sector, but if Wal-Mart's hurting then Family Dollar Stores (FDO -1.1%), Dollar General (DG -1%), Five Below (FIVE -1.3%), and Dollar Tree (DLTR +2.9%) may also have issues with consumers tightening beyond just mid- to higher-end items..
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • BB

    More on BlackBerry (BBRY -6.8%): Deutsche's Brian Modoff is questioning early reports (from...

    More on BlackBerry (BBRY -6.8%): Deutsche's Brian Modoff is questioning early reports (from Thorsten Heins and others) of strong Z10 demand in the U.K. and Canada. Deutsche's survey of 60 stores in the countries found no sellouts in the U.K., and that those in Canada were attributed by reps to limited supplies. Meanwhile, Detwiler Fenton notes in its report Samsung "has been poaching key engineers and managers" from BlackBerry as it ramps its enterprise efforts. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 71 Comments
  • WMT

    Wal-Mart (WMT -3.1%) responds to a leaked internal memo indicating February sales are weak by...

    Wal-Mart (WMT -3.1%) responds to a leaked internal memo indicating February sales are weak by noting to CNBC that an executive was issuing an opinion rather than any official company data. While true, the alarm bells are still ringing. The Wal-Mart VP of finance and logistics on February: "The worst start to a month I have seen in my ~7 years with the company." Look for the topic to come up during the firm's earnings conference call on February 21.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 17 Comments

  • The XLP, XRT, and XLY all give up gains and turn lower following Wal-Mart sounding the warning...

    The XLP, XRT, and XLY all give up gains and turn lower following Wal-Mart sounding the warning over the effects of the payroll tax hike. It's fascinating that it took markets until just now to react to what was crystal clear 6 weeks ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM | 2 Comments
  • DVA

    DaVita (DVA -1.5%) trades lower today on a downgrade to Neutral on relative valuation at Goldman...

    DaVita (DVA -1.5%) trades lower today on a downgrade to Neutral on relative valuation at Goldman Sachs. The firms notes that while its outlook for core dialysis remains solid, we expect slower growth with less upward momentum relative to its peers over the next 12-24 months."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 2 Comments
  • COST

    Other retail stocks slumping suddenly from positive territory on worries kickstarted by...

    Other retail stocks slumping suddenly from positive territory on worries kickstarted by Wal-Mart's payroll tax warning: COST -0.6%, DKS -0.9%, PSMT -1.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 4 Comments
  • WWR

    Uranium Resources (URRE +21.7%) obtains $9M in new surety bonds for the remediation and...

    Uranium Resources (URRE +21.7%) obtains $9M in new surety bonds for the remediation and reclamation of its South Texas projects. The new bonds will require $4.5M in cash collateral and will replace the existing $9M of fully collateralized financial surety instruments; as a result of the lower cash collateral requirement, $4.5M will be released back to URRE.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • WMT

    Wal-Mart (WMT -3%) takes another leg down after an exec confirms what Cleveland Research warned...

    Wal-Mart (WMT -3%) takes another leg down after an exec confirms what Cleveland Research warned on earlier - February sales are off to a disastrous start due in part to the expiration of the payroll tax cut. No surprise, but shares of Target (TGT -2.6%) are falling hard as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 12 Comments
  • STJ

    St. Jude Medical (STJ -3.4%) has been working overtime to convince the Street that its Durata...

    St. Jude Medical (STJ -3.4%) has been working overtime to convince the Street that its Durata heart device leads are safe, but Cowen doesn't take the bait, downgrading the stock to Market Underperform over concerns that the new heart wire is no different from the ones already taken off the market. The firm cites a "significant risk" of a recall, which would " meaningfully damage" its defibrillator and pacemaker business.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • FOLD

    Amicus Therapeutics (FOLD -24.7%) tanks after reporting additional Stage 1 results from the...

    Amicus Therapeutics (FOLD -24.7%) tanks after reporting additional Stage 1 results from the ongoing Phase 3 study of oral migalastat HCl monotherapy in patients with Fabry disease. Initial top-line results previously reported in December, 2012 for the primary endpoint in Stage 1 did not meet statistical significance. The pre-specified primary and secondary analyses of the primary endpoint numerically favored migalastat HCl over placebo, but not enough to allay investor concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • Z

    Zillow (Z +6.3%) and Trulia (TRLA +12.4%) continue to surge as shorts flee for cover following...

    Zillow (Z +6.3%) and Trulia (TRLA +12.4%) continue to surge as shorts flee for cover following the companies' Q4 reports (I, II). Zillow had 41.1% of its float shorted as of Jan. 31, and Trulia 18.2%. The real estate sites/app developers are now respectively up 24% and 45% since Tuesday's close. (more)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • DDD

    Volatile 3D Systems (DDD -5.6%) continues to sell off in the wake of Citron Research's bearish...

    Volatile 3D Systems (DDD -5.6%) continues to sell off in the wake of Citron Research's bearish report. Some industry peers are also falling: PRLB -4.1%. XONE -3.7%. SSYS -1.6%. Fidelity recently disclosed it bought 3.1M shares of 3D Systems in Q4, raising its stake in the company to 6.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM | 27 Comments
  • RKUS

    Ruckus Wireless (RKUS -11.1%) is falling hard again; shares are down 20% since the company...

    Ruckus Wireless (RKUS -11.1%) is falling hard again; shares are down 20% since the company delivered a Q4 beat and in-line Q1 guidance on Tuesday. On its earnings call, Ruckus did note it expects its 2013 profits to be affected some by sales/R&D investments, but struck an upbeat tone about demand. Rival Cisco bragged on its call service provider Wi-Fi hardware sales more than doubled Y/Y. Needham downgraded Ruckus to Hold on Wednesday, citing a high valuation (7x 2014E EV/sales).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • GPS

    The minds of retail analysts are spinning after ESL Partners discloses (13G) a sizable 14.32M...

    The minds of retail analysts are spinning after ESL Partners discloses (13G) a sizable 14.32M stake in Gap (GPS +6%) and helps fuel speculative buying of the retailer. With Eddie Lampert already squeezing value out of the assets of Sears Holdings (SHLD +0.4%), the unanswered question is what does Eddie have up his sleeve that might add value to Gap, Sears, and Kmart all the same time?
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • WWR

    Midday top 10 gainers: URRE +21%. QLIK +18%. VBFC +17%. SAAS +16%. BIOF +15%. MM +12%. ONP +11%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: URRE +21%. QLIK +18%. VBFC +17%. SAAS +16%. BIOF +15%. MM +12%. ONP +11%. BVX +12%. RBPAA +12%. XRSC +11%.
    Midday top 10 losers: LOGM -29%. FOLD -24%. EHTH -22%. CJJD -17%. BOSC -12%. END -11%. ASGN -11%. RKUS -11%. IPGP -10%. WHX -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • CDE

    Coeur d'Alene Mines (CDE -2.4%) says it increased its total combined proven and probable...

    Coeur d'Alene Mines (CDE -2.4%) says it increased its total combined proven and probable reserves and measured and indicated resources of silver and gold by 17% and 12%, respectively, resulting in the addition of 85.2M silver oz. and 462K gold oz. at year-end 2012 vs. 2011. Silver and gold resources at CDE's Palmarejo mine in Mexico rose 169% Y/Y to 45.7M oz. and 370% to 964K oz.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • GLD

    Gold's now in a clear downtrend, taking out new technical lows, hit by (3-month old) news big...

    Gold's now in a clear downtrend, taking out new technical lows, hit by (3-month old) news big names are selling, and now the chart's starting to form the dreaded "death cross." All the gold bugs need for a perfect bullish setup would be Paul Krugman taking to the air to declare victory for all he believes ... check. GLD -1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 43 Comments
  • LOGM

    LogMeIn (LOGM -28.7%) goes into freefall following its Q4 report. Though results beat estimates,...

    LogMeIn (LOGM -28.7%) goes into freefall following its Q4 report. Though results beat estimates, the provider of mobile apps/services for remote PC access guided for Q1 revenue of $36M-$36.5M and EPS of $0.09-$0.10, below a consensus of $38.2M and $0.18. Also, 2013 guidance is for revenue of $154M-$157M and EPS of $0.43-$0.49, below a consensus of $164.1M and $0.81. LogMeIn, which faces plenty of competition, has authorized a $25M buyback, currently good for repurchasing 6% of shares. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • LPNT

    Lifepoint Hospitals (LPNT +1.8%) moves up on a Q4 earnings beat this morning. Net earnings fell...

    Lifepoint Hospitals (LPNT +1.8%) moves up on a Q4 earnings beat this morning. Net earnings fell 3.7% Y/Y however, as the rural hospital operator continued to see fewer admissions and surgeries, albeit slightly more revenue per patient. Guidance was also mixed, with the company forecasting FY13 earnings of $2.73 to $3.11 a share on net revenue of $3.65B to $3.75B. Street estimates are for $3.24 per share on $3.6B.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • CHK

    Natural gas names such as Chesapeake (CHK -1.4%), Petroquest (PQ -3.8%) and EOG (EOG -2.7%)...

    Natural gas names such as Chesapeake (CHK -1.4%), Petroquest (PQ -3.8%) and EOG (EOG -2.7%) slump after experts say the Marcellus Shale gas boom will slow this year as drillers wait for pipelines to expand, new markets to develop and wholesale prices to rise. Hiring has tapered off, a big difference from recent years when production soared and companies spent billions on leases, well drilling and infrastructure.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM | 6 Comments
  • TLGT

    IGI Laboratories (IG +2.2%) trades up after signing a three-year agreement with Juventio LLC to...

    IGI Laboratories (IG +2.2%) trades up after signing a three-year agreement with Juventio LLC to manufacture and supply finished dose forms of certain cosmetic and OTC products and formulations owned and developed by IGI. The products utilize encapsulation technology trademarked as Novasome for which the company currently holds an exclusive license.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • WMT

    Wal-Mart (WMT -2%)  slides as it appears sales are taking a hit from this year's payroll...

    Wal-Mart (WMT -2%)  slides as it appears sales are taking a hit from this year's payroll tax increase. Cleveland Research says comps are running negative YTD (Street expects +1.9%) amidst a broad slowdown in consumer spending. "The magnitude at WMT seems more significant than we would have expected."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 10 Comments
  • ABBV

    AbbVie (ABBV +2.7%) moves up today after announcing a $1.5B stock-buyback program as the company...

    AbbVie (ABBV +2.7%) moves up today after announcing a $1.5B stock-buyback program as the company seeks to boost shareholder value. The repurchase plan, which is effective immediately, is expected to be completed over several years. The plan has no time limit and can be discontinued at any time.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • ECYT

    Endocyte (ECYT +3.9%) moves higher today after Roth Capital Partners have initiated coverage of...

    Endocyte (ECYT +3.9%) moves higher today after Roth Capital Partners have initiated coverage of biopharmaceutical firm with a Buy rating and a $15 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • NEPT

    Shares of Neptune Technologies & Bioressources (NEPT +0.8%) return to earth after being up...

    Shares of Neptune Technologies & Bioressources (NEPT +0.8%) return to earth after being up over 8.7% in pre-market trade, after JMP Securities initiated the stock earlier at Outperform with a lofty $6 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • APA

    Apache (APA -2.8%) says a relief rig is en route to the location of an offshore Louisiana well...

    Apache (APA -2.8%) says a relief rig is en route to the location of an offshore Louisiana well where natural gas may have been flowing underground for more than a week. The well is shut in and blowout preventers are functioning properly, but testing had detected an underground migration of gas from the bottom of the well.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM | 5 Comments
  • XOOM

    Xoom (NASDAQ:XOOM) opened at $21 and is currently moving at $21.94, up 37.1% from an IPO price...

    Xoom (NASDAQ:XOOM) opened at $21 and is currently moving at $21.94, up 37.1% from an IPO price of $16. That gives the online money transfer service a market cap of $698M, or 8.7x 2012 sales. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • MNST

    Shares of Monster Beverage (MNST +6.9%) keep spiking higher as chatter picks up that the company...

    Shares of Monster Beverage (MNST +6.9%) keep spiking higher as chatter picks up that the company could be a takeover target. A buyout makes some sense with beverage industry volumes - both beer and soda - sluggish and Monster in some need of a refresh after taking on some criticism over the health effects of its energy drinks. Is Coca-Cola (KO +0.3%) back in the picture? (previous: KO-MNST talk)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 9 Comments
  • BB

    After rallying yesterday in the face of Jim Balsillie's disclosure, BlackBerry (BBRY -4.3%) is...

    After rallying yesterday in the face of Jim Balsillie's disclosure, BlackBerry (BBRY -4.3%) is lower again today. A possible culprit: Detwiler Fentor reports Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) plans to unveil an "enterprise platform" at the Feb. 25-28 Mobile World Congress. However, Samsung's SAFE initiative, which provides enterprise security/management tools for its mobile hardware, is already well-known. As is the fact BlackBerry faces competition on the device management software front from Good Technology, SAP, Citrix, and others.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 9 Comments
  • PKD-OLD

    Parker Drilling (PKD-OLD -1.8%) says it will record a $15.8M charge to cover a proposed...

    Parker Drilling (PKD-OLD -1.8%) says it will record a $15.8M charge to cover a proposed settlement with the U.S. government relating to possible violations of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act in a case that has ensnared several explorers. PKD also expects to report a Q4 net EPS loss of $0.03-$0.05, citing slower demand for barge drilling rigs and increased competition in the rental tools market.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • ABT

    Shares of Abbott Labs (ABT +1%) tick higher after being initiated by analysts at Stifel Nicolaus...

    Shares of Abbott Labs (ABT +1%) tick higher after being initiated by analysts at Stifel Nicolaus with a Buy and a price target of $40 per share, noting that the drug giant is a solid performer that delivers reliable and consistent earnings growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • SQNS

    4G baseband chipmaker Sequans (SQNS -3.5%) slumps to $1.66 after pricing a 9M-share offering at...

    4G baseband chipmaker Sequans (SQNS -3.5%) slumps to $1.66 after pricing a 9M-share offering at $1.50. Sequans, which has been posting sizable losses as it struggles to compete against Qualcomm and other larger rivals, only says it will use the proceeds for "general corporate purposes." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • MM

    Millennial Media (MM +8.1%) surges after Oppenheimer's Jason Helfstein predicts the mobile ad...

    Millennial Media (MM +8.1%) surges after Oppenheimer's Jason Helfstein predicts the mobile ad network owner will report solid Q4 results on Tuesday, and states his research indicates Millennial will face limited mobile ad competition in the near-term (ed: Google's AdMob seems a formidable rival). Helfstein, who smartly made a bullish call on Millennial ahead of its Q2 report, also notes the company's very high short interest (45.5% of the float was shorted as of Jan. 31).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM | 1 Comment
  • UHAL

    Amerco (UHAL +2.3%) rises as SA Pro author Kerrisdale Capital argues the orphaned stock (no...

    Amerco (UHAL +2.3%) rises as SA Pro author Kerrisdale Capital argues the orphaned stock (no guidance, small float, no sell-side coverage, no regular dividend) deserves a premium to the S&P market multiple instead of its current substantial discount (11x vs. 15x). In addition to U-Haul, Amerco also is a substantial property owner through its self-storage facilities, and this could be converted to a sizable REIT.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • LEE

    Lee Enterprises (NYSE:LEE) falls 7.5% premarket after Warren Buffett discloses he trimmed his...

    Lee Enterprises (NYSE:LEE) falls 7.5% premarket after Warren Buffett discloses he trimmed his position in the company even further during Q4. (13F)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • IPGP

    More on IPG Photonics: Q1 guidance is for revenue of $145M-$155M and EPS of $0.65-$0.75 vs. a...

    More on IPG Photonics: Q1 guidance is for revenue of $145M-$155M and EPS of $0.65-$0.75 vs. a consensus of $145.5M and $0.72. Q4 book-to-bill was below 1 (it was also below 1 in Q3). Gross margin was 51.8%, down 320 bps Q/Q and 200 bps Y/Y. The company says North American and Asian were healthy (was Europe weak, given the revenue miss?). R&D expenses +41% Y/Y and sales/marketing +34%, each well above revenue growth. IPGP -7.9%. CC at 10AM ET (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • QLIK

    Premarket gainers: QLIK +18%. HLF +17%. AEG +5%.Losers: LOGM -26%. IPGP -9%. LEE -8%.

    Premarket gainers: QLIK +18%. HLF +17%. AEG +5%.
    Losers: LOGM -26%. IPGP -9%. LEE -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) trades weak in premarket action, down 4.3%, with Credit Suisse chiming in...

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) trades weak in premarket action, down 4.3%, with Credit Suisse chiming in with a dour reiteration of its Underperform rating and Morgan Stanley chipping away at profit estimates on the retailer. Any kind of short-term trading in JCP looks as dangerous as ever with longs (Vornado, State Street, Pershing Square) and shorts (60M) duking it out.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM | 10 Comments
  • CCL

    Carnival (NYSE:CCL) may face a large number of lawsuits because the crippled cruise ship which...

    Carnival (NYSE:CCL) may face a large number of lawsuits because the crippled cruise ship which dominated the news cycle over the last few days had a litany of mechanical problems in its history. Though the growth of the travel industry isn't expected to be damaged by the high-profile incident, Carnival has already lopped off $0.08 to $0.10 to H1 earnings due to the mishap, an estimate which could move even higher as legal headaches mount. CCL -0.5% premarket, down around 5% post-Triumph stranding.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • FXY

    The yen reverses early strength and shoots lower on more wordage out of the G-20, with one...

    The yen reverses early strength and shoots lower on more wordage out of the G-20, with one official saying Japan is not being singled out in the group communique urging members to avoid competitive devaluation. FXY -0.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:16 AM | 9 Comments
  • MPAA

    Motorcar Parts of America (NASDAQ:MPAA): FQ3 EPS of $0.06 may not be comparable to consensus of...

    Motorcar Parts of America (NASDAQ:MPAA): FQ3 EPS of $0.06 may not be comparable to consensus of by -$0.06. Revenue of $116.3M (+38% Y/Y). Shares +2.8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM
  • KHC

    Kraft Foods (KRFT) falls 1.1% premarket after its Q4 report looks troubling at first glance due...

    Kraft Foods (KRFT) falls 1.1% premarket after its Q4 report looks troubling at first glance due to a double-digit fall in revenue. An extra week in last year's Q4 contributed 4.2 percentage points to the drop, while other factors for the revenue skid include product pruning and a reduction in trade inventories.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • RIG

    Transocean (NYSE:RIG) -2.9% premarket after Deutsche Bank cuts shares to Sell from Hold,...

    Transocean (NYSE:RIG) -2.9% premarket after Deutsche Bank cuts shares to Sell from Hold, pointing to yesterday's fleet status report which showed a 7% increase in 2013 downtime and the first estimate of 2014 downtime is up an additional 5% vs. 2013. Meanwhile, costs are rising even as rates are flattening. The firm also believes most potential catalysts have been realized.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM | 5 Comments
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) is taking steps to develop land around its corporate headquarters in...

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) is taking steps to develop land around its corporate headquarters in Plano, Texas which could set up the properties for future sales. The bigger issue: The retailer is under the cash microscope with its moves in the credit markets highly scrutinized and a promise out to Wall Street to have one billion in cash by the end of Q4. JCP -2.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:06 AM | 5 Comments
  • HLF

    We welcome Carl Icahn's Herbalife (NYSE:HLF) investment, Bill Ackman tells CNBC, saying his...

    We welcome Carl Icahn's Herbalife (NYSE:HLF) investment, Bill Ackman tells CNBC, saying his conclusion about the company (pyramid scheme) is unaffected by who's on the other side of the trade.     Herbalife (NYSE:HLF) up 23% premarket following in Carl Icahn's Valentine's Day Massacre of Bill...

    Herbalife (NYSE:HLF) up 23% premarket following in Carl Icahn's Valentine's Day Massacre of Bill Ackman. Kid Dynamite notes Icahn has an economic interest in 13% of HLF, but does not own all that stock. Instead he has a combination of long stock, long calls and short puts. His exit strategy for the position is in question, but it's clear Icahn's goal is to create a short squeeze. Grab the popcorn.
